reviews.text: Walk around, sit on the street, get lost yourself and take a cerveza !!! You will feel the city in El Born.

Passeig del Born is a lovely road/area in La Ribera (El Born).
It is located behind Basilica de Santa Maria del Mar.
It ia a wonderful and cosy place for walking, like most of the old town, Ciutat Vella.

This area is full of shops and restaurants.  Some shops are clearly touristy while others are local vendors selling everything from handmade jewelry and leather goods.  I love spending a half a day here checking out the latest wears and grabbing a a bite to eat at one of the many local restaurants.
Beautiful locality to spend an afternoon strolling by. Multiple souvenir shops, if you need to get any. Also very scenic, to catch photographs. Food stalls also nearby.

Catalans place to have a great time! Warm and exciting neighbour! Take beer and sit somewhere with friends. Go to del Born pizza have sangria drink coctails! But please do not make noise! People live there! 

And see the square next to St. MARIA for the sake of anarchists who defended that city! 

P.S. you should definitely observe buildings and balconies. Balconies broaden up to down just for the right of sunlight!
The restaurants along the Passeig del Born are almost as touristy as the ones along Las Ramblas. But it is a beautiful stroll in a lovely neighborhood, with interesting sites all around.

Worth a visit! Lovely little cafes and ice creams shops in the main square which are lovely to sit at in the sun. 
Nice small shops on all the surrounding passages too!
This is a great street to walk down.  Lots of interesting cafes and shops.  We enjoyed a tranquil stroll down this serene street.
Great neighborhood with a lot of life during the day and during the night. Nice restaurants and little cafes.

A short and charming avenue with a medieval flavor and a modern feeling. It is a vibrant, lively street that stretches from the old market to the Santa Maria del Mar church. It was a historical place for celebrations and festivities (“Born” means jousting field) which is very much the main idea today - to enjoy in the deep shade of trees and have a stroll along the street.
We've lived there during our trip to Barcelona. Very beautiful area with good cafes, bars, shops. Quiet. Highly recommend .
This is a very eclectic neighborhood. It's has lots to offer including some great Vermouth Bars. You know when you run into one of your waiters on his day off, you've come to the right place!

Passeig del Born is one of those old Barcelona neighbourhoods that has been rejuvenated by tourists and hip/ trendy cafes. Unfortunately, just as awesome as it was to be able to get excellent craft beer and baked pasties at 3AM in the morning, I was also racially accosted in a dark alley and robbed of my phone. The pickpockets 'worked' at me for quite a bit, trying to strike up conversations or getting close to me to 'show' Bollywood dance. I was sleepy and drunk, but was able to get rid of them... for a while; they cornered me while I was walking towards a taxi stand and robbed me.

These things happen; was able to replace my cheapo phone soon enough. That said, does leave a sour taste in your mouth; sadly, all my memories of this place are now overshadowed by this experience.
Nice place for walking around and having a look to all the small shops and workshops at Born. A lot of cafes are around.
Very nice atmosphere and lively area. So many good addresses of restaurants, bars and shops. I recommend...

Born is a wonderful neighbourhood in Barcelona. Passeig del Born is a great street plenty of shops where you can always find unbelievable items and food. Very nice in the morning and romantic in the evening.

Spare a moment and wander down the streets of Passeig del Born. Look up and around, and you will find a cosy neighbourhood surrounding you. What may seem like chaos, on the other adds charm to this place. Take the weight of your feet and pop yourself at one of the many small cafes and just watch people go by.
It is a historical place, with wonderful architecture to appreciate, it is also well cared for and it is safe to walk around.

Fantastic place to stay while in Barcelona, cobbled widing streets that lead you everywhere lovely bars, restaurants, supermarkets even pharmacies on every corner and a great area to take amazing photos. Safe area with the locals.

This part of Barcelona has some very interesting and fascinating architecture.  It is immediately behind the Basilica Santa Maria and close to the Picasso Museum and many excellent restaurants. Stroll around the open area and then into the smaller streets for a good feel of old town Barcelona

The Passeig del Born is one of the main central streets in the El Born district. Full of restaurants, bars, cafes, shops, etc, it is a very lively and busy area. Quite touristic, it is an area where you should take care f your belongings. Nightlife is plentiful and active, so this area in one of the main centres for a night out. Recommended!
Great place to have fun, meat new people and see some of all nationalities in Barcelona at the time. Attention: highly touristic area!

20 years ago Born was a no-go area
It's now a must see, very safe, and great for individual shops and this small avenue is lovely - see it at night, lit up and take a refreshment at Bar del Born
While here see Museu Pcasso - 1 minute from this Passeig on Montcada

El born is itself an awesome neighbourhood, the best for me. I used to travel quiet a lot to Barcelona until the time I moved there. Passeig del Born was definatelly the place I was always ended up when the night was for few drinks and friendship. Is not the touristy rambla at all, you have the mix between tourists and locals, a lot of different types of bars and a totally different vibe in the square, where everybody stand having a chat.
Its probably a place that people are not sending you to but that you should check-it out. You will definatelly spend a nice time there as whatch the typical figures of the Born. Is good to have just a relaxed drinks night or either to start your night out!
make sure you explore all the side streets, have a coffee, watch the world go by, browse until lunch time then enjoy a very leisurely lunch in one of the many eateries !! Enjoy
Unlike some parts of Barcelona this place is nice and relaxed. Less sign of obvious pick pockets unlike ramblas. The museum type place is good too where you can see the old city parts.

From its architecture, the park coves, the shops and markets, the people - this neighborhood is abuzz with genuine characteristics of the city. On a trivial note: they also shot a scene Penelope Cruz's "All About My Mother".

The Passeig del Born is a very busy street with many people all the time. The architecture is that of the past and there are many interesting stores located here. At the end one can find the beautiful Church of Santa Maria del Mar.

We stayed in an apartment just off it and selected it deliberately for the bars and restaurants in the area. A good mix of locals and some tourists, it has a more authentic feel than other areas and it shows in the shops and bars. Also a short walk to the beach. I would defiantly stay around there again.

This is a great neighborhood to spend some time in. Went to a few of the restaurants and bars here and they all had a lively and authentic atmosphere. I woudl recommend the meatballs at Origens and grab a drink at Crepes al Born! They are a pack local bar with really fun and inventive drinks - you can also get made to order crepes there AND they have free wifi!

We are currently staying on this street in an apartment. There are plenty of bars and restaurants and its nice to wander down. Close to the port and not too far from the beach. Its lovely to stay and worth a wander if you are close by but I don't think I'd recommend it if you were specifically coming here out of your way. The park at the end is also lovely.
El born is a great place for strolling, shopping and eating. This part is nice as well, good shops and great vibe. Beautiful trees!
Escape the overly touristy La Rambla and head to the Born to enjoy the authentic look and feel of Barcelona.

Even with a map I couldn't find specific streets but it didn't matter. Wander through the alleys for lots of accessories, some leather goods, a few clothes designers, some giftware -- pretty good range of prices.
Amazing!! Everything its connected, the bars and restaurants are affordable, a lot of shopping options.
El Born is an cool area with lots of great bars, restaurants, cafes and boutique shops from local & independent designers. Definitely a must go!!!!!!!

We stayed just around the corner from here and our local supermarket was here as well as the coctail bar we visited every night. We also saw the local Haloween celebrations and it was very good. I loved it,  it's not as busy as you would expect, some nice places to eat and at night a few nice pubs.
Enjoyed walking around this area discovering artisan shops and restaurants.  Less touristy and a great escape from Las Ramblas.
We spent some time in this neighborhood and the adjacent neighborhoods in Barcelona, and had a great time.   So many choices for food, drinks, and shops!
Go here in the evening, cosy place and maybe some street performance! When we were there we saw a live band performing on the street!

I'm so glad I decided to rent an apartment in this lovely and lively area   So much charm and kits of unique local boutiques.  Most weren't my style but still cool to see all the artisans. Oh and if course all the lovely pubs and restaurants in the area make it an awesome place to wonder off into. Enjoy!
Check out the pizza place there, run by Argentines. You select pizza by the slice, and eat in a bar-like atmosphere..
It's a beautiful little avenue with several shops and bars on both sides of the street. Just make sure you don't get your wallet stolen!

Irreverence must be one of the adjectives to be applied to Barcelona and, that is one of the things you'll find around the Passeig del Born!
A place worth visiting for at least an afternoon.
Don't forget to visit some local shops, some very vintage and taste an icecream in one of the many italian icecream shops!
a lot of places to eat and drink. Walk through narrow streets, better places and a lot cheaper. Enjoy night life also
This neighborhood isn't to be missed during a visit to Barcelona.  Chic, trendy, a lot to do and see.  Great places to eat and shop also!

Born - great for watching the world go by - of you're on a budget ,mc Donald's has a seperate little easy access coffee /muffin counter at the front of the store good quality and half the price of cappuccino next door !
This is a really nice street to walk down in Barcelona. Its not as busy as Los Rambla, and has a good mix of bars, shops and good architecture.

Only visiting to know.
You do not need going anywhere to have all you need. It is not the cheapper place to eat or buy anything, but it is THE place!
My wife is thinking in living here forever. I think she is right and I am thinking I will stay with her forever!
Wander around here in the afernoon and it's an everyday street, come back after dark when it comes to life.

I must admit, Passeig del Born was one of my favourite place to stroll around when we were in Barcelona.

We mostly walked here in the late afternoon/early evening, and it was very lively, but not overly crowded. It's full of shops, bars, wonderful buildings and a few wonderful street performers. It felt very homely, and it could easily be my favourite part of the city.

On our trip we stayed in Barri Gotic, which we loved, but if (when!) we return to Barcelona, we will definitely try to find a place to sleep in el Born. It's wonderful!

If you are touring Barcelona, this is a must see on your list.  
It's in the main street of Born neighborhood and it is full of shops, restaurants/tapas, coffee shops, and not to mention Picasso museum and the great Santa Maria del Mar Cathedral standing tall right in the middle of the Passeig.   It's very crowded by days with tourists and locals but lively by night with mostly locals.  Sometimes they pull a all night sales on all the shops and it would be as crowded as daytime; I am not a night persona but I have been to one and it was very fun worth staying up for. 

Also, it is a street for young people to be in since young fashion designers prefer to live and have small shops in this neighborhood.
There's always something happening in the Passeig del Born + lots of lovely places to have a drink, tapas or a proper meal
